Events that occurred on 29 June.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - J.R.R. Tolkien succumbs to gastritis while at Brocton Camp, and is sent to Brooklands Officers' Hospital in Kingston-upon-Hull.
1935 - Author Robert Giddings is born.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 74.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the Preface to The Ancrene Riwle.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 164.
1967 - Gene Deitch's adaptation of The Hobbit is shown to a limited audience in New York City.
1972 - The Daily Telegraph describes actions of the Forestry Commission as bringing a "Tolkien gloom". Tolkien responds.
1976 - Actor Bret McKenzie is born.
1977 - J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography is published in the US.

content.title: In Arda
content.content: There are no known events on this day.
